q: What does EDI stand for in the history of EC?
Which EC category refers to transactions among various organizational departments?
Which generation of EC is based on Web 2.0 tools and social media?
Which term refers to conducting all kinds of business online, including servicing customers and collaborating with partners?
Which EC transaction type involves retail sales from businesses to individual shoppers?
Which of the following is NOT a benefit of EC?
Which of the following is an example of C2C e-commerce?
opts: A government portal providing tax services

q: What percentage of EC volume is approximately B2B?
What is a virtual world also known as?
Which term refers to computing systems involving social interactions and behaviors?
A ride-sharing app like Uber operates on a model where people share services using technology. What is this economic system called?
A company pays website owners to display its ads and shares revenue from clicks. Which business model is this?

A startup creates a social media campaign where customers share posts about its products, generating organic promotion. Which model is this?
Maria sells handmade crafts on eBay to other individuals. Which EC category does this represent?
A business uses Web 2.0 tools to allow customers to share reviews and collaborate online. Which generation of EC is this?
Which of the following is a major barrier to EC adoption?
What is an intranet?
opts: A public network connecting businesses globally
A corporate internal network using Internet tools
A network linking multiple organizations securely
A virtual world for social networking
a: A corporate internal network using Internet tools

q: Which EC model involves selling products online directly from manufacturer to customer?
Which EC model uses email and social networks for word-of-mouth advertising?
Which term refers to an economic system based on sharing goods and services among participants?
A consumer posts a request for a custom-made product and businesses bid to fulfill it. Which EC category applies?
A government portal allows citizens to pay taxes online. What type of EC transaction is this?
A company uses blogs and wikis to collaborate on product design with its partners online. Which concept is applied?
A retailer partners with a manufacturer to sell products online and share profits. Which EC relationship does this describe?
A business uses an extranet to securely share inventory data with suppliers. Which network type is this?
A company resists adopting e-commerce due to fear of fraud and lack of skilled employees. What is this an example of?
A local coffee shop wants to sell its products online directly to customers without intermediaries. Which EC model best fits this scenario?
A company uses an internal network to share HR policies and payroll information with employees. What is this network called?
Which of the following is a characteristic of the digital economy?
A large corporation invites suppliers to submit bids for a contract through an online platform. Which EC model is being used?
Which category of EC refers to government transactions with businesses or citizens?
What does Electronic Commerce (EC) primarily refer to?
opts: Using the Internet and intranets to trade data, goods, or services
a: Using the Internet and intranets to trade data, goods, or services

q: A government agency uses an online system to purchase IT equipment from private companies. Which EC type applies?

A business buys raw materials from another company through an online marketplace. What type of EC transaction is this?
Which of the following is NOT a major component of the EC framework?
A virtual reality platform allows users to create avatars and interact in a simulated environment. What is this called?
Which business model charges a fee for making markets?
